titles: Several proposalls tendred to the considerations of the honorable committee for regulating of courts of justice, for a through reformation thereof, and the generall satisfaction of all the nation, save only some 20 or few more of the head officers; who being taken away, and these proposals granted, will save the Commonwealth many hundred thousand pounds in few yeeres.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Commonwealth and Protectorate, 1649-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
